title: 107_s1129
content:
There are no paragraphs provided in the prev_chunk, so I will summarize the curr_chunk directly:

"PROVISIONS RELATING TO CERTAIN OFFICES AND POSITIONS WITHIN THE EXECUTIVE BRANCH." "Amendment to Executive Schedule Pay Rates under title 5, United States Code, includes redesignation of subsections and adjustment of annual pay rates for General Schedule employees in the District of Columbia." The annual pay rates for Executive Schedule positions in the District of Columbia are adjusted based on the percentage adjustment for General Schedule employees in the same area. The adjustment is rounded to the nearest multiple of $100. The annual pay rates for Executive Schedule positions in the District of Columbia are adjusted based on the percentage adjustment for General Schedule employees in the same area. An annual rate of pay, as adjusted, shall be treated as the annual rate of pay for the positions involved, except as otherwise provided in subsection (a) or any other provision of law. No adjustment under this subsection shall continue after the comparability payment for General Schedule employees within the area. The adjustment under paragraph (1) may continue after the comparability payment for General Schedule employees in DC has ended. Section 5372a of title 5, US Code is amended to ensure contract appeals board members receive no less than 97 percent of the rate under paragraph (1). The adjustment for contract appeals board members' pay rates will be no less than 94 percent of the rate under paragraph (1), and will be adjusted by the President as appropriate. The President will adjust rates of basic pay for contract appeals board members under the General Schedule. Conforming amendments to Section 5318 of title 5, United States Code, include specifying the adjustment percentage and excluding previous adjustments. The President will adjust rates of basic pay for contract appeals board members under the General Schedule, with amendments excluding previous adjustments under certain provisions of title 5, United States Code. The President will adjust rates of basic pay for contract appeals board members under the General Schedule, with amendments excluding previous adjustments under certain provisions of title 5, United States Code, including limitations on certain payments for specific employees. The President will adjust rates of basic pay for contract appeals board members under the General Schedule, with amendments excluding previous adjustments under certain provisions of title 5, United States Code. This includes substituting the annual rate of salary of the Vice President of the United States for the annual rate of basic pay payable for level I of the Executive Schedule. Additionally, references to level IV of the executive schedule are amended to level III in various sections of title 5, United States Code. SEC. 2. PROVISIONS RELATING TO CERTAIN OFFICES AND POSITIONS WITHIN THE JUDICIAL BRANCH. Increase in Maximum Rates of Basic Pay Allowable for certain positions within the judicial branch under title 28, United States Code. The amendment limits the rate of basic pay for employees covered by section 604(a)(5) to level IV of the Executive Schedule. Additionally, the pay rates for circuit executives are now capped at level III of the Executive Schedule. The amendment limits the rate of basic pay for employees covered by section 604(a)(5) to level IV of the Executive Schedule, and for personnel of the administrative office of the United States courts, the pay rates are now capped at level III of the Executive Schedule. The amendment adjusts pay levels for certain positions, changing level IV to level III of the Executive Schedule under section 5314 of title 28, United States Code. The pay levels for certain positions are adjusted, changing level IV to level III of the Executive Schedule under section 5314 of title 28, United States Code. Additionally, the salary of the Director of the Administrative Office of the United States Courts is amended by replacing "district" with "circuit" in section 603 of title 28, United States Code. The amendments made by this Act will be effective for pay periods starting on or after the enactment date.
